Subject: Re: [EXT] [archive-crawler] Re: Scope Rules

Content-Type: text/plain; charset="Windows-1252"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Regarding your question about wildcard rejection of all WordPress subdomain=
s, you could use a SURT form of wordpress.org in you `SurtPrefixedDecideRul=
e` REJECT bean values. Try `+http://(org,wordpress,` instead of `https://wo=
rdpress.org/`.  Please read about SURTs and SURT prefixes on the Heritrix3 =
GitHub wiki: https://github.com/internetarchive/heritrix3/wiki/Glossary#sur=
t to understand how this form works.

Another option (though in this case t=
he SurtPrefixedDecideRule is likely more efficient) is to use a regular exp=
ression to determine if an URL should be rejected using a `MatchesListRegex=
DecideRule`. There is an example in this previous message of using this typ=
e of rule: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/archive-crawler/conversation=
s/messages/8976. For further information on this and other scope rules plea=
se view: https://github.com/internetarchive/heritrix3/wiki/Configuring-Craw=
l-Scope-Using-DecideRules.

Looking at your crawler-beans.cxml, you should =
move the SurtPrefixedDecideRule where you are rejecting worpress.org into t=
he `scope` beans list of rules (or reference it from in this list using an =
`id` as you are doing with the `acceptSurts` bean). You can replace the oth=
er REJECT SurtPrefixedDecideRule currently appearing in that list of rules =
with the one you have, but change your wordpress.org value to use SURT form=
:

    <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.SurtPrefixedDeci=
deRule">
          <property name=3D"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
         =
 <property name=3D"seedsAsSurtPrefixes" value=3D"false"/>
          <proper=
ty name=3D"surtsDumpFile" value=3D"${launchId}/negative-surts.dump" />
    =
      <property name=3D"surtsSource">
           <bean class=3D"org.archive=
.spring.ConfigString">
            <property name=3D"value">
             <=
value>
              +http://(org,wordpress,
             </value>
        =
    </property>
           </bean>
          </property>
    </bean>

Inclu=
ding this rule here after the `TransclusionDecideRule` should mean you are =
rejecting the wordpress.org URLs even if they are perceived as embed links =
on one of the pages you have accepted for crawling.

Lauren Ko
UNT Librarie=
s

<html>
<head>
<meta http-equiv=3D"Content-Type" content=3D"text/html; chars=
et=3DWindows-1252">
<style type=3D"text/css" style=3D"display:none;"><!-- P=
 {margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0;} --></style>
</head>
<body dir=3D"ltr">
<di=
v id=3D"divtagdefaultwrapper" style=3D"font-size:12pt;color:#000000;font-fa=
mily:Calibri,Helvetica,sans-serif;" dir=3D"ltr">
<p style=3D"margin-top:0;m=
argin-bottom:0"></p>
<div>Regarding your question about wildcard rejection =
of all WordPress subdomains, you could use a SURT form of wordpress.org in =
you `SurtPrefixedDecideRule` REJECT bean values. Try `+http://(org,word=
press,` instead of `https://wordpress.org/`.  Please read
 about SURTs=
 and SURT prefixes on the Heritrix3 GitHub wiki: https://github.com/interne=
tarchive/heritrix3/wiki/Glossary#surt to understand how this form works.</d=
iv>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>Another option (though in this case the Surt=
PrefixedDecideRule is likely more efficient) is to use a regular expression=
 to determine if an URL should be rejected using a `MatchesListRegexDecideR=
ule`. There is an example in this previous message of using
 this type of r=
ule: https://groups.yahoo.com/neo/groups/archive-crawler/conversations/mess=
ages/8976. For further information on this and other scope rules please vie=
w: https://github.com/internetarchive/heritrix3/wiki/Configuring-Crawl-Scop=
e-Using-DecideRules.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>Looking at your crawler-be=
ans.cxml, you should move the SurtPrefixedDecideRule where you are rejectin=
g worpress.org into the `scope` beans list of rules (or reference it from i=
n this list using an `id` as you are doing with the `acceptSurts` bean). Yo=
u
 can replace the other REJECT SurtPrefixedDecideRule currently appearing =
in that list of rules with the one you have, but change your wordpress.org =
value to use SURT form:</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>    <bean =
class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.SurtPrefixedDecideRule&q=
uot;></div>
<div>          <property name=3D=
"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/></div>
<div>  &nbs=
p;       <property name=3D"seedsAsSurtPrefixes"=
 value=3D"false"/></div>
<div>        &nbs=
p; <property name=3D"surtsDumpFile" value=3D"${launchId}/=
negative-surts.dump" /> </div>
<div>      &nbsp=
;   <property name=3D"surtsSource"></div>
<div>  =
         <bean class=3D"org.archive.spring=
.ConfigString"></div>
<div>          &nbsp=
; <property name=3D"value"></div>
<div>     =
        <value></div>
<div>      &=
nbsp;       +http://(org,wordpress,</div>
<div>  &n=
bsp;          </value></div>
<div>  &nb=
sp;         </property></div>
<div>    =
       </bean></div>
<div>      &n=
bsp;   </property></div>
<div>    </bean></div>
=
<div><br>
</div>
<div>Including this rule here after the `TransclusionDecid=
eRule` should mean you are rejecting the wordpress.org URLs even if they ar=
e perceived as embed links on one of the pages you have accepted for crawli=
ng.</div>
<div><br>
</div>
<div>Lauren Ko</div>
<div>UNT Libraries</div>
<p=
></p>
